LAGRANGE EMERGENCY DEPT VISIT
LOUIS,ROBERT 855-88-85-2 VISIT DATE: 01/10/72
This patient was interviewed and examined by me exclusively.
PRESENTING COMPLAINT: Chest pain.
HISTORY OF PRESENTING COMPLAINT: This patient is a 67-year-old
male who has known atherosclerotic coronary heart disease
manifested by myocardial infarction approximately five years ago.
He also has congestive heart failure with an ejection fraction of
25%, and this is thought to be due to alcoholic cardiomyopathy
given a substantial history of alcohol ingestion. Over the past
several months, he has stopped taking his medicine because he could
not get to his doctor and felt he could not buy the medicine. Over
the past two weeks, he has been beset by palpitations and dyspnea
on exertion as well as palpitations at rest.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: He has had no vomiting, diaphoresis, radiation
of the pain, change in bowel habits or any cough. All of the
systems are negative.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: He has had no significant surgeries.
SOCIAL HISTORY AND FAMILY HISTORY: He consumes alcohol slightly,
once smoked in the past, but does not any longer. He lives with
his family.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: GENERAL: Physical examination shows a
patient who is awake, alert, calm and oriented. He is in no
distress at the time of examination. EYES: He had no scleral
icterus. NECK: There was no adenopathy. His thyroid was not
palpable. CHEST: His chest was clear. CARDIOVASCULAR: His
cardiovascular exam showed a regular rate and rhythm. ABDOMEN:
His abdomen was soft and nontender. EXTREMITIES: His extremities
showed no clubbing, cyanosis or edema. SKIN: He had no rash.
NEURO: Neurologic exam was physiologic.
LABORATORY EVALUATION: Electrocardiogram showed tachycardia and
T-wave inversion diffusely, which was unchanged from prior
electrocardiogram. His CK and troponin were unremarkable. His
troponin was 1.1, which was similar to a previous admission.
THERAPY RENDERED/COURSE IN ED: The patient was treated with beta
blocker and aspirin in the Emergency Department.
FINAL DIAGNOSES:
1. Angina pectoris.
2. Hypertension.
3. Tachycardia.
DISPOSITION (including condition upon discharge): The patient was
admitted to the Medical service for further evaluation. He was
admitted in satisfactory condition.
